page.title: 06Bawtry Health Centre
page.content: Two doctors' practices are housed in this pleasant red brick building which was built in 1979.The five doctors each have a surgery but share an open- plan waiting room.There are also treatment rooms which are used for ante and postnatal clinics and a baby clinic with posters on the wall and part of the floor carpeted.A sound proof room is used for testing hearing and for speech therapy.There is also a chiropodist's room.The centre has a friendly,welcoming atmosphere and the facilities are modern and bright. Home nurses also use the centre as their base for visiting families in the locality. There are plenty of toilets including provision for the disabled. Car parking for the patients is in the front of the building and an entrance hall accommodates prams and push- chairs.
